subject: Ethics
title: Peter Singer on Animal Suffering
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Peter Singer on Animal Suffering.

hook.text: A philosopher asked one question in 1975 and started a global movement: can animals suffer?

buildup.text: Peter Singer's 'Animal Liberation' argued that ignoring animal pain is a moral prejudice, like racism.

discovery.text: Singer's key claim: if a being can suffer, its suffering matters morally, regardless of its species.

twist.text: Singer isn't arguing animals are equal to humans. He's arguing equal suffering deserves equal weight.

climax.text: His utilitarian framework doesn't ban all meatâ€”it bans causing unnecessary suffering for trivial pleasure.

punchline.text: The question isn't 'can they think?' It's 'can they suffer?'

quiz.question: What is Peter Singer's core ethical argument about animals?
options: Animals are intellectually equal to humans
Only domesticated animals deserve moral consideration
If a being can suffer, its suffering matters morally regardless of species
